_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



A.    Introduction & Stationary Source and Regulated Substance Handled



Ottawa Cooperative is a supplier of fertilizer, agrichemical, seed and other inputs to farmers. Bulk and packaged products are received via transport trucks and stored for the eventual sale to farmers. This facility has an excellent safety record with no deaths or serious injuries to plant personnel or contractors due to the RMP covered process. There have been no accidents in the past 5 years.  This facility is a stationary source holding for sale anhydrous ammonia as a retail facility to agricultural producers.  This facility is subject to Program Level 2 RMP Requirements as part of the Clean Air Act 112(r).



B.     Accidental Release Prevention Policies and Program



This facility strives to meet or exceed compliance with state and federal anhydrous ammonia regulations. Training is provided for each new hire and re-hire employee and also every three years as required by OSHA.  The anhydrous ammonia tank(s) and associated equipment are inspected following recommended industry and engineering frequencies as are spelled out in the maintenance program within the RMP itself.



C.    Emergency Response Policies and Programs



Each employee is trained to be familiar with the emergency action policies and procedures through safety reviews and other safety meetings.  This facility has an Emergency Plan which covers accidental releases, natural disasters, security incidents and other emergency practices and procedures. The Emergency Action Plan for this facility is reviewed annually and updated on an as needed basis as part of a comprehensive review process.  The Emergency Plan for this facility includes specific instructions for the employees regarding the procedures to an emergency.  The procedures provided in the Emergency Plan are shared with all employees and followed in the event of an emergency.  Ottawa Cooperative is a non-responding facility and in the event of a catastr

ophic release where the emergency shutoff cannot be activated, Ottawa Cooperative will call 911 and engage first responders.  The local emergency planning committee and fire department personnel are furnished with a copy of our chemical inventory for this facility and invited for a tour on an annual basis.  



D.    Worse-Case Scenario/Alternative-Case Scenario



This facility has developed a worse-case and an alternative-case scenario however it has been withheld from this Executive Summary as security-sensitive information as requested by EPA.



E.    Five Year Accident History



This facility has an excellent safety record with no deaths or serious injuries to any of its employees as a result of the RMP covered process. In addition, there have been no accidents resulting in releases of anhydrous ammonia with off-site consequences during the previous 5 years. Extensive programs and procedures are in place to maintain this record.



F.    Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Management of this company and facility continuously look for ways to enhance the safety of this location. Annual equipment inspections are conducted, and detailed environmental health and safety audits are conducted at least every three years.  When deficiencies are identified, an outlined plan is documented with timelines for corrections.



G.    Summary



The employees of this company are proud of our safety record and vast improvements made in both environmental stewardship and safety. We believe with our programs and policies in place and with the continued efforts of our personnel, we will maintain our safety record and our facility's environment for the public, our customers and our employees for years to come.
